instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>)  Looking into the crystal ball!
threads.message:
Today I fixed a board that had corrosion under <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> which operates the 25Mhz crystal. I was like wow. Look on the scope. The crystal comes and goes.
Pulled <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> repealed and replaced and Bam! I got fan spin. so.... I dive into the toybox! I knew there were tons of <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> boards in there!

Toy Box first one I grab! <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>) does the exact same thing! <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M</SIGNAL> is erratic. Pops in for a split second. Just long enough for my Tek 784 to trigger lock and and let me see. Then it is gone. Each time it does this I see the current bounce a few mA. Like it was just about to wake up. I changed <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and Y1905 (careful not to overtemp) and no change.

<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> pin 1 (<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>) 3.3v
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> pin 13 (<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>) 3.42v
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> pin 5 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN</SIGNAL>) 3.3v
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> pin 2,3 (<SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_X2</SIGNAL> and X1) intermittent 25Mhz signal

I am thinking that because all these parts come from donors I could easily be throwing bad parts on the board but I have tried twice now. Stop me before I rape a working board! These crystal circuits are not magic. There is not much to them. GIve <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> power and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN</SIGNAL> and Y1905 should sing like a canary. Hopefully I am wrong here and am missing something.

My Toy Box is boards I could not quickly resolve.   eBay has been a great way to learn!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>)  Looking into the crystal ball!

threads.message: 25 mhz output from the crystal is intermittent bursts and not stable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>)  Looking into the crystal ball!
threads.message:
Because your board tries to start and do not stays in S0.
Your problem is not there.
